translated: Long Discourses
The Characteristics

“Monks!”

original: “Dvattiṁsimāni, bhikkhave, mahāpurisassa mahāpurisalakkhaṇāni, yehi samannāgatassa mahāpurisassa dveva gatiyo bhavanti anaññā.

original: Sace agāraṁ ajjhāvasati, rājā hoti cakkavattī dhammiko dhammarājā cāturanto vijitāvī janapadatthāvariyappatto sattaratanasamannāgato.

translated: If he lives the home life, he will become a ruler, a wheel-turning righteous monarch of the law, who has conquered the border regions in the four directions and ensures security in his realm. He possesses the seven treasures and has this as his seventh treasure.
His seven treasures are:

original: Seyyathidaṁ—cakkaratanaṁ hatthiratanaṁ assaratanaṁ maṇiratanaṁ itthiratanaṁ gahapatiratanaṁ pariṇāyakaratanameva sattamaṁ.
